supportDesc.support: Paper, partly of the reddish colour of birch bark.
supportDesc.condition: ff. 1, 57, 98, 99, 108, 109, 726, and 727 are damaged, and ff. 100, 104–107, 110–112, 114–128, and 133 are slightly injured.

handNote.p: Rājānalasaka, who gives his name in the colophons of nos. 3, 7, 9, and 11. With the exception of no. 2, and probably no. 14, the other Nāṭakas are clearly written by the same hand.

origin.p: the bulk of the MS. must have been written in the (Saptarṣi) saṃvat years 69 and 70 1694. This appears from the dates given in the colophons of nos. 3, 7, and 9. F. 164: saṃ 69 caitra vati tṛtīyāyāṃ likhitaṃ | F. 461v: saṃ 70 ?? cuti 1 śukre likhitaṃ mayā | F. 514. saṃvat 70 vai śuti caturdaśyāṃ bhaumavāsare likhitaṃ mayā Rājānalasakena |

history.acquisition: Bought in 1887 from Dr. Eugen Hultzsch (MSS. 99, 102, 108, 105, 94, 101, 109, 98, 107, 106, 91, 110, 97, 103). Memorandum on original wrapper (f. 1), ‘Śrīnagar, K. No.1–14.’

recordHist.source:
Summary description abbreviated from the following sources:
Winternitz and Keith, Catalogue of Sanskrit manuscripts, no. 1247 (1–15), pp. 174-176

availability.p: Entry to read in the Library is permitted only on presentation of a valid reader's card (for admissions procedures contact Bodleian Admissions). Contact specialcollections.enquiries@bodleian.ox.ac.uk for further information on the availability of this manuscript.

listBibl.head: Printed descriptions:
listBibl.bibl: Moriz Winternitz and Arthur Berriedale Keith, Catalogue of Sanskrit manuscripts in the Bodleian Library (Oxford, 1905), no. 1247 (1–15), pp. 174-176

msContents.summary: the Prabodhacandrodaya, a drama in six acts, by Kṛṣṇamiśrācārya, with an interlinear or marginal Sanskrit version of the Prākrit passages.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ ǁ prajānyaḥ ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ǁ oṃ madhyāhnārkamarīcikāso iva payaḥ pūro prajñānataḥ | &c.
msItem.explicit: iti niṣkrāntāḥ sarve ǁ jīvanmuktir nāma ṣaṣṭho ’ ṅkaḥ ǁ ǁ ǁ samāptam idaṃ Prabodhacandrodayaṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ ǁ ǁ kṛtiḥ śrīkṛṣṇamiśrācāryapādānāṃ ǁ śubham astu sarvatra ǁ

msContents.summary: the Hanumannāṭaka, or Mahānāṭaka, a drama in fourteen acts, by Dāmodara Miśra.

msItem.incipit: oṃ śrīrāmāya salakṣmaṇāya sasītāya sahanumate namaḥ ǁ śubham astu ǁ bhadraṃ oṃ kalyāṇānāṃ nidhānaṃ kalimalamathanaṃ jīvanaṃ sajjanānāṃ … eyaṃ yac ca divyaṃ sapadi parapadaprāptaye prasthitasya | I
msItem.explicit: caturdaśabhir evāṅkair bhuva [nān] i caturdaśa | śrīrānianāṭakaṃ dhatte kevalaṃ brahmanirmalam ǁ racitam Anilaputreṇātha Vālmīkinābdhau nihitam amṛtabuddhyā prāṅ Mahānāṭakaṃ yat | Sumatinṛpatibhojenoddhṛtaṃ tat krameṇa grathitam avatu viśvaṃ Miśradāmodareṇa ǁ ǁ ǁ ǁ iti Hanumannāṭake śrīrāmavijayo nāma caturdaśo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ samāptam idaṃ Mahānāṭakaṃ ǁ

msContents.summary: the Vidagdhamādhava, a drama in seven acts, by Rūpa Gosvāmin
the Mālatīmādhava, a drama in ten acts, by Bhavabhūti.

msItem.incipit: oṃ śrīgaṇeśaya namaḥ oṃ cūḍāpīḍakapālasaṅkulamilanmandākinīvārayo vidyutkāśalalāṭalocanaśikhijyotir vimiśratviṣaḥ | &c.
msItem.explicit: kāma evam etat iti niṣkrāntās sarve daśamo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ samāptaṃ cedaṃ Mālatimādhavaṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ ǁ kṛtir mahākaver vividhabudhacakramrājitapāda-dvayāmbhojasya śrībhaṭṭabhavabhūler iti bhadraṃ ǁ

msContents.summary: the Abhijñānaśakuntala, a drama in seven acts, by Kālidāsa.

msItem.incipit: śrīsarasvatyai namaḥ | yā sraṣṭus sṛṣṭir ādyā pibati vidhihutaṃ | &c.
msItem.explicit: punarbhavaṃ parigatabhaktir ātmabhūḥ ǁ iti niṣkrāntās sarve ǁ ǁ saptamo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ ǁ ǁ samāptaṃ cedam Abhijñānaśakuntalānāma nāṭakaṃ ǁ ǁ ǁ kṛtir mahākaveḥ Kālidāsasyeti śivaṃ ǁ

msContents.summary: the Bālarāmāyaṇa, by Rājaśekhara, with on interlinear Sanskrit version of the Prākrit passages.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ śrīsarasvatyai namaḥ ǁ śrīśāradāyai namaḥ śreyase ǁ pramatter yaḥ pātraṃ tilakayati yas sūktiracanāṃ ya ādyas svādūnāṃ śruticulakalehyena madhunā | &c.

msContents.summary: the Veṇīsamhāra, a drama in six acts, by Mṛgarājalakṣman Bhaṭṭa Nārāyaṇa.

msItem.incipit: oṃ kālin-dījalakālakāliyakulakrīḍāvināśaiśinā ruṣṭhāriṣṭhakaṭho-rakaṇṭhavalanāviśliṣṭhakaṇṭhasrajā rohatkeśikiśoradan-tapadavīkṛṣnena puṣṇātu vo doṣṇā durdaradaityadar-padalanadvāreṇa dāmodaraḥ ǁ
msItem.explicit: kāvyālāpasubhāṣitavyasaninas te rājahaṃsā gatā goṣṭhyas tāḥ kṣayam āgatā guṇalavaślāghāpravādaḥ sa tān sālaṅkārarasoktivakramadhurāyās satkavīnāṃ giras tāsāṃ prājñāmṛte guṇāntaravidaḥ ke mlecchitānām iva ǁ iti niṣkrāntās sarve | ṣaṣṭho ’ṅkaḥ ǁ ǁ samāptaṃ cedaṃ Veṇīsaṃhāraṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ ǁ kṛti kaver Mṛgarājalakṣmaṇo Nārāyaṇasya ǁ

msContents.summary: the Bālabhārata, or Pracaṇḍapāṇḍava, a drama in two acts, by Rājaśekhara.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ǁ ǁ oṃ namaḥ Sarasvatyai ǁ ǁ oṃ namaś Śivāya ǁ &c.
msItem.explicit: maukharyeṇa ǁ iti niṣkrāntāḥ sarve ǁ ǁ dvitīyo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ ǁ kṛtir mahākave Rājaśekharasya |

msContents.summary: the Vikramorvaśī, a drama in five acts, by Kālidāsa, with an interlinear Sanskrit version of Prākrit passages.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ śrīśāradāyai namaḥ ǁ vedānteṣu | &c.

msContents.summary: the Ratnāvalī, a drama in four acts, by Śrīharṣa, or Harṣadeva.

msItem.incipit: oṃ namo vighnahantre ǁ oṃ pādāgrasthitayā | &c... pātu naḥ ǁ 1 ǁ It ends: ākalpantaṃ ca sasyā bhavatu samucitaṃ saṃgataṃ sajjanānāṃ nirviśleṣavaka (?) śaṃ piśunajanavacovarja (?) nād vajralepaḥ ǁ iti niṣkrāntās sarve gataś caturtho ’ṅkaḥ | iti śrīharṣaviracitā Ratnāvalī nāma nāṭikā samāptā | śubhaṃ bhavatu jagatāṃ |

msContents.summary: the Anargharāghava, a drama in seven acts, by Murāri.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ śrīgurave namaḥ oṃ niṣpratyūham upāsmahe | &c.

msContents.summary: the Kṛṣṇabhakticandrikāvidhāna, a drama, by Ānandadeva, the son of Āpadeva.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti | śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ | śrīgurubhyo namaḥ | Sarasvatyai namaḥ ko ’pi sa gopakumāraḥ sphurati samāje vrajastrīṇāṃ navajaladhara iva madhye taḍitāṃ paritaḥ sphurantīnāṃ |
msItem.explicit: iti śrīmatāpadevasūnunā ’nandadevena kṛtaṃ śrīkṛṣṇabhakticandrikāvidhānaṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ samāptam iti bhadraṃ | śrīkṛṣṇajayakṛṣṇajayajayakṛṣṇeti mantramauliṃ dhyayet | nīlotpalānandakarīkavīnām Ānandadevena kṛtā Murāreḥ | sānandadhanā paritovalakṣaṃ bhaktyā yaśodāsuta candrikeyaṃ |

msContents.summary: the Nāgānanda, a drama in five acts, by Srīharṣa, or Harṣadeva.

msItem.incipit: oṃ svasti ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ǁ ǁ śreyo ’stu ǁ oṃ dhyānavyājam upetya cintayasi kam unmīlya cakṣuḥ kṣaṇaṃ paśyānaṅgaśarāturaṃ janam amuṃ trātāpi no rakṣasi |
msItem.explicit: ºpramodāḥ prajāḥ ǁ iti niṣkrāntāḥ sarve ǁ pañcamo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ ǁ ǁ samāptaṃ cedaṃ Nāgānandanaṃ nāma nāṭakaṃ ǁ ǁ kṛtiś śrīharṣadevasya ǁ

msContents.summary: the Hanumannāṭaka, or Mahānāṭaka, by Dāmodara Miśra.

msItem.incipit: oṃ namaḥ sarasvatyai ǁ ǁ śrīrāmāya namaḥ ǁ śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ǁ (so far Devanāgarī) śrīgaṇeśāya namaḥ ǁ oṃ namaḥ śrīrāmacandrāya ǁ ǁ ǁ oṃ kalyāṇānāṃ nidhānaṃ kalimalamathanaṃ pāvanaṃ pāvanānāṃ pātheyaṃ yanmumukṣoḥ sapadi parapadaprāptaye prasthitasya ǁ
msItem.explicit: iti śrīhanumadviracite mahānāṭake Sītāviyogo Rāmapañcamo ’ṅkaḥ ǁ

msContents.summary: fragments containing only a few syllables of which nothing can be made (probably bits of waste paper originally used as lining by the native binder).
